content:
• Friday, May 4, 2012
  • CVC

    Cablevision (NYSE:CVC) +1.5% AH after WSJ reports it will try to sell its Clearview Cinemas...

    Cablevision (NYSE:CVC) +1.5% AH after WSJ reports it will try to sell its Clearview Cinemas movie theater chain and has hired Citigroup to advise on the process. CVC is no stranger to shedding assets; in recent years, it spun off AMC Networks and Madison Square Garden, attempting to focus on growing its core cable business.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM
  • AIG

    The U.S. Treasury says it has launched another public offering of its AIG common stock and that...

    The U.S. Treasury says it has launched another public offering of its AIG common stock and that AIG has indicated it will purchase up to $2B in the offering. The size and price of the offering have not been determined. Treasury still owns ~1.25B AIG shares, or 70% of the insurer's common shares. AIG -3.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • WLK

    Westlake Chemical (NYSE:WLK) withdraws its $1.2B bid to buy Georgia Gulf (GGC) after a sweetened...

    Westlake Chemical (NYSE:WLK) withdraws its $1.2B bid to buy Georgia Gulf (GGC) after a sweetened $35/share offer was rejected as too low. WLK says it plans to sell its 4.8% stake in GGC “as market conditions permit.” WLK +1.2%, GGC -9.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • TPC

    Tutor Perini (NYSE:TPC): Q1 EPS of $0.08 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.48. Revenue of...

    Tutor Perini (NYSE:TPC): Q1 EPS of $0.08 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.48. Revenue of $912.5M (+48% Y/Y) misses by $187M. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • AIG

    AIG (AIG -3.8%) shares sink despite a largely favorable Q1 report, as investors eye an imminent...

    AIG (AIG -3.8%) shares sink despite a largely favorable Q1 report, as investors eye an imminent sale of part of the Treasury's 70% ownership in the company. Shares have surged 40% YTD too, and Bernstein's Josh Stirling sees "a little bit of profit-taking,” plus the market may be overreacting to misunderstood comments regarding the insurer’s restructuring.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • INVN

    InvenSense (INVN -25.5%) crashes after reporting in-line FQ4 EPS but guiding for FQ1 revenue of...

    InvenSense (INVN -25.5%) crashes after reporting in-line FQ4 EPS but guiding for FQ1 revenue of $38M-$40M, below a $41.6M consensus. The company says it was tripped up by component shortages for 4G phones containing its motion sensors - the comments suggest Qualcomm's (NASDAQ:QCOM) 28nm supply issues were a factor. Oppenheimer previously aired concerns about competition, as well as a May 15 post-IPO share lockup expiration.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 5 Comments
  • JPM

    CLSA's Mike Mayo lowers JPMorgan Chase (JPM -2.6%) to Underperform, not expecting results to get...

    CLSA's Mike Mayo lowers JPMorgan Chase (JPM -2.6%) to Underperform, not expecting results to get appreciably better than the bank’s so-so Q1. Negative signs for the U.S. economy don't help either, he says, since consumer loans, 60% of JPM’s balance sheet credit exposure, would continue to be a drag on performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 4 Comments
  • AMN

    AMN Healthcare Services (AHS +12%) pops after beating Q1 estimates late yesterday. Revenue grew...

    AMN Healthcare Services (AHS +12%) pops after beating Q1 estimates late yesterday. Revenue grew by 5% Y/Y on strength in its travel nurse business. Baird views the improvement as just the beginning. The company's key nursing segment has continually improved over several quarters, and shows no sign of abating. The firm ups its rating to Outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • EQU

    Equal Energy (EQU +10.2%) says it is initiating a strategic review, including the potential sale...

    Equal Energy (EQU +10.2%) says it is initiating a strategic review, including the potential sale of all or a portion of its assets, or the outright sale of the company. Shares are undervalued: No other company with 50% liquids production trades at such low multiples within the junior-to-medium Canadian oil and gas space.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • TG

    Tredegar (TG -10.1%) takes a hit after missing Q1 estimates across the board. Net profit slid...

    Tredegar (TG -10.1%) takes a hit after missing Q1 estimates across the board. Net profit slid despite stronger sales, as expenses and asset impairments weakened bottom line results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (IDCC +6.5%), hammered last week by a poor Q1 report, is rallying after announcing...

    InterDigital (IDCC +6.5%), hammered last week by a poor Q1 report, is rallying after announcing a $100M stock buyback program, good for repurchasing 8.1% of all shares at current levels. In addition, the 3G/4G patent holder is guiding for Q2 revenue of $71M, above a $67.1M consensus. The guidance is partly due to the sale of 4 patent families, which InterDigital says is unrelated to its efforts to unload larger portfolios.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPWR

    Though its Q1 revenue miss wasn't as bad as rival First Solar's, SunPower (SPWR -3.2%) is...

    Though its Q1 revenue miss wasn't as bad as rival First Solar's, SunPower (SPWR -3.2%) is following the market lower. Probably not helping is its guidance for Q2 revenue of $575M-$650M and EPS of -$0.20 to -$0.05, largely below a consensus of $638.9M and -$0.05. Caris thinks SunPower faces "an uphill battle for profitability." But Citi, which just turned bullish on solar, is pleased with SunPower's gross margin, and expects the company's modules to maintain a price premium. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy (SWN -7.8%) is the S&P 500's biggest loser, as Q1 profit fell 21% with...

    Southwestern Energy (SWN -7.8%) is the S&P 500's biggest loser, as Q1 profit fell 21% with margins weakened by softer realized natural gas prices and higher expenses. Sterne Agee still sees some positives: SWN showed "strong expense control" even as it had to spend more money on new projects, and some new wells look promising.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • SPRD

    BofA, which aired a bearish note on Spreadtrum (SPRD +15.9%) on April 17, is upgrading shares to...

    BofA, which aired a bearish note on Spreadtrum (SPRD +15.9%) on April 17, is upgrading shares to Neutral as they take off due to a huge Q1 EPS beat and strong Q2 revenue guidance. Nonetheless, the firm says it remains cautious due to Spreadtrum's weak smartphone app processor position, limited EPS visibility, and rival MediaTek's technology edge, among other things.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • UAL

    Airlines are holding up well, as today's plunge in crude prices outweighs broader economic...

    Airlines are holding up well, as today's plunge in crude prices outweighs broader economic concerns: UAL +3.8%, DAL +1.4%, LCC +0.8%. Southwest (LUV -0.9%) is the exception; it's often more active in hedging out its oil price exposure, somewhat softening the significance of the drop of more than 5% in oil prices from this week's peak.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • AAL

    US Airways (LCC +1.1%) moves up on a weak tape after Sabrient Systems' David Brown lines it up...

    US Airways (LCC +1.1%) moves up on a weak tape after Sabrient Systems' David Brown lines it up as one of his top picks as he gets pulled in by LCC's attractive 4X future earnings multiple.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • POWI

    Analog chipmakers Power Integrations (POWI +13.5%) and International Rectifier (IRF -11.1%) head...

    Analog chipmakers Power Integrations (POWI +13.5%) and International Rectifier (IRF -11.1%) head in opposite directions after reporting earnings. POWI posted a strong Q1 beat and Q2 sales guidance of $78M-$84M, above a $74.4M consensus. IRF provided in-line FQ4 guidance (revenue of $255M-$270M vs. $261.7M consensus) to go with its FQ3 beat. The company says demand from Asian industrial and home appliance customers remains soft. (IRF transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • MD

    Mednax (MD -3.5%) slides again today, this time on a downgrade to Hold at Deutsche Bank, saying...

    Mednax (MD -3.5%) slides again today, this time on a downgrade to Hold at Deutsche Bank, saying the company's slower deal pace, coupled with a change in margin profile due to the mix of acquired businesses, will lead to less multiple expansion than originally thought.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • DISH

    Dish Network (DISH -2.7%) threatens to drop all of AMC's (AMCX -2.7%) networks due to "setbacks"...

    Dish Network (DISH -2.7%) threatens to drop all of AMC's (AMCX -2.7%) networks due to "setbacks" from aging litigation between the two companies. Shows airing on AMC that could get pulled off of Dish's programming include Mad Men, Breaking Bad and The Walking Dead, although the report has all the hallmarks of a negotiating tactic.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • ESV

    Shares of Ensco (ESV -4.8%) continue their slide today on the back of its Q1 earnings miss...

    Shares of Ensco (ESV -4.8%) continue their slide today on the back of its Q1 earnings miss earlier this week. Pritchard is defending the stock, upping it to Buy on improving market fundamentals and saying the driller paints "a very bullish picture for the offshore landscape going forward."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • CTCT

    Constant Contact (CTCT +3.2%) rallies following an upgrade to Buy from Stifel. The firm thinks...

    Constant Contact (CTCT +3.2%) rallies following an upgrade to Buy from Stifel. The firm thinks CTCT is "quickly becoming the small business marketing platform of choice," as it expands beyond e-mail marketing into areas such as social media marketing. It sees new products and international expansion led to a re-acceleration of new customer adds in 2H12, along with improvements in ARPU and churn. (Canaccord)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • PEGA

    Pegasystems (PEGA -10%) gets slammed after missing Q1 estimates yesterday. Total revenue...

    Pegasystems (PEGA -10%) gets slammed after missing Q1 estimates yesterday. Total revenue actually rose 8.6% Y/Y on strength in its emerging energy, manufacturing, and government segments, but bottom line results were hit by higher material costs and acquisition expenses. Separately, William Blair cuts the shares to Neutral on valuation, citing the company's earnings volatility on the back of the results.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -6.4%) execs did their best to defend the company at its annual shareholder meeting...

    Nokia (NOK -6.4%) execs did their best to defend the company at its annual shareholder meeting in the face of crumbling sales, profits, market share, and debt ratings. But Robert Chmielinski is one investor who clearly isn't satisfied. He's filing a class-action suit against Nokia, alleging it misled investors by promising Windows Phone sales would strengthen its smartphone position. Nokia declares the suit to be without merit.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 13 Comments
  • HAIN

    Hain Celestial Group (HAIN +7.1%) shoots up after beating the estimates of analysts with both...

    Hain Celestial Group (HAIN +7.1%) shoots up after beating the estimates of analysts with both lines of its FQ3 report. Separately, the company says it snapped up Irish soup maker Cully & Sully for an undisclosed amount in a deal that it expects to be accretive to earnings in FY13.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (ROVI -7.6%) sells off after missing Q1 revenue estimates, albeit while maintaining its...

    Rovi (ROVI -7.6%) sells off after missing Q1 revenue estimates, albeit while maintaining its 2012 guidance. During its earnings call, Rovi blamed the shortfall on declining sales of its analog content protection technology, as well as weaker-than-expected growth for its Entertainment Store platform. It was also mentioned CFO/COO James Budge will be leaving in mid-May, and Chief Accounting Officer Peter Halt will step in as CFO.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • YRCW

    YRC Worldwide (YRCW -6.1%) falls off after missing the estimates of analysts with its Q1 report...

    YRC Worldwide (YRCW -6.1%) falls off after missing the estimates of analysts with its Q1 report and restating 2011 results to reflect accounting changes to how prepaid tires are booked.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • CBM

    Life Sciences research firm Cambrex (CBM +13%) pops after its Q1 results easily topped Street...

    Life Sciences research firm Cambrex (CBM +13%) pops after its Q1 results easily topped Street estimates late yesterday. Overall revenue rose 14% Y/Y on higher sales of controlled substances and generic active pharmaceutical ingredients. The company also raises sales projections for FY12, now expecting sales to increase between 2% - 6% year-over-year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • CFN

    CareFusion (CFN +4.4%) gains after its FQ3 results beat expectations late yesterday. Net...

    CareFusion (CFN +4.4%) gains after its FQ3 results beat expectations late yesterday. Net earnings actually fell 31% Y/Y on losses related to the disposal of one of its divested businesses, but adjusted profit improved on double-digit revenue growth in its dispensing, infusion and respiratory segments.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • CNX

    S&P lowers its outlook on Consol Energy (CNX -1.4%) to stable from positive, maintaining its...

    S&P lowers its outlook on Consol Energy (CNX -1.4%) to stable from positive, maintaining its rating, saying the coal producer and the industry at large face challenges in 2012 that will crimp performance, although its low-cost coal operations should remain strong enough to fund its capex programs and maintain its finances.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • UAL

    United Continental (UAL +3.3%) trades higher after a report breaks that it's close to buying 100...

    United Continental (UAL +3.3%) trades higher after a report breaks that it's close to buying 100 737s from Boeing. Investors could be latching on to the carrier's ability to upgrade its fleet and cut fuel costs a bit faster than rivals.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • QLGC

    QLogic (QLGC -11.9%) tumbles after posting a mixed FQ4 report. BMO (Market Perform) thinks the...

    QLogic (QLGC -11.9%) tumbles after posting a mixed FQ4 report. BMO (Market Perform) thinks the results, together with archrival Emulex's (ELX -2.2%) uninspiring June quarter outlook, suggests a slower-than-expected ramp for Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) Romley server CPU platform, which many have expected will lead to a pickup in data center IT spending. The report might also be weighing on Brocade (BRCD -4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Brean Murray cuts Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -2.1%) to Hold from Buy, a day after the stock...

    Brean Murray cuts Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -2.1%) to Hold from Buy, a day after the stock took an earnings-related dive. Jefferies also weighs in, lowering its price target to $24 from $28. With 15 out of 20 analysts offering up buy ratings, there's plenty of room for more downgrades on this long-term underperformer.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM

  • A sharp decline turns into a free-fall, WTI crude at $97.90/barrel, now more than $8 cheaper...

    A sharp decline turns into a free-fall, WTI crude at $97.90/barrel, now more than $8 cheaper than it was about 72 hours ago. USO -4.3%. Previously moving solidly higher, gold reverses to turn slightly red at $1,634/oz. GLD -0.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 16 Comments
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -4%) is making new all-time lows after badly missing Q1 estimates and...

    First Solar (FSLR -4%) is making new all-time lows after badly missing Q1 estimates and appointing a permanent CEO, though the bloodletting seen in recent months is limiting its decline. During its earnings call, First Solar noted ASPs for solar modules fell another 13% Q/Q in 2012, though it expects pricing to improve. DNB Markets is upgrading shares to Buy on hopes of improving cash flow. Others are more cautious for the expected reasons (I, II, III).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 7 Comments
  • ZAGG

    Zagg (ZAGG +6.5%) trades higher following its Q1 earnings beat - defying the large number of...

    Zagg (ZAGG +6.5%) trades higher following its Q1 earnings beat - defying the large number of critics (short-sellers?) the company has piled up along the way. Bulls will point to news that company could see a boost in the coming quarter, as Wal-Mart begins selling Zagg's products.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • MSFT

    Piper raises its PT on LinkedIn (LNKD +6.7%) to $145 following its Q1 beat, which featured...

    Piper raises its PT on LinkedIn (LNKD +6.7%) to $145 following its Q1 beat, which featured strong across-the-board growth, and purchase of SlideShare. The firm sees positive user metrics boding well for future job posting and ad sales, and is also intrigued by LinkedIn's mobile and college opportunities. Needham also sees plenty of growth ahead for LinkedIn, but thinks it's fully baked into its lofty valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • LF

    Leapfrog (LF +15.1%) jumps higher after reporting a much narrower loss in Q1 than forecast and...

    Leapfrog (LF +15.1%) jumps higher after reporting a much narrower loss in Q1 than forecast and issuing rosy guidance for full-year 2012 on the strength of sales of its education-related products. In a CC, Leapfrog execs tip off that the next step for the company is to create an app market geared for its kids-oriented tablet.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • CBOU

    Shares of Caribou Coffee (NASDAQ:CBOU) fall 17.9% in early trading after the firm lowers its...

    Shares of Caribou Coffee (NASDAQ:CBOU) fall 17.9% in early trading after the firm lowers its outlook for revenue and profit in FY12. Behind the pain, it's weak single-cup coffee sales that paint a picture - along with GMCR - that consumers aren't changing their coffee-drinking habits at the pace anticipated. CBOU -30% for the week.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +5.1%) finally turns north after it effectively played a...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +5.1%) finally turns north after it effectively played a bad joke on investors by conducting a 2-for-1 split without distributing the shares. Shorts taking profits and comments out from Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz that K-Cup sales are seeing gains could be behind the rise.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 12 Comments
  • DRIV-OLD

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD -12.8%) tumbles after its soft Q2 guidance overshadows its Q1 beat....

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD -12.8%) tumbles after its soft Q2 guidance overshadows its Q1 beat. Blaming Europe's macro woes, the company says it expects Q2 revenue of $92M-$94M and EPS of $0.17-$0.19, below a consensus of $95.3M and $0.22. Digital River, which provides e-commerce infrastructure solutions, has been posting growth well below that of the U.S. e-commerce market. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • MU

    Micron (MU +4.2%) has won the bidding war for bankrupt Elpida, according to Japanese broadcaster...

    Micron (MU +4.2%) has won the bidding war for bankrupt Elpida, according to Japanese broadcaster NHK. The report comes after SK Hynix said it had dropped out of the bidding. Micron recently announced a convertible note offering many thought was Elpida-related. Hopes are up that an Elpida sale will lead to a further reduction in global DRAM capacity, and thus allow DRAM prices to continue their 2012 rally.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • CF

    CF Industries' (CF -4.2%) Q1 earnings rose 31%, but Dahlman Rose's deeper look implies this...

    CF Industries' (CF -4.2%) Q1 earnings rose 31%, but Dahlman Rose's deeper look implies this is as good as it gets. The firm says unusually warm winter weather, which allowed for significant fertilizer application, a post-WWII record corn planting and other factors "created near perfect-storm conditions, which will be hard to exceed or even replicate in the near future."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • USO

    WTI crude drops into double-digits for the first time in 3 months, touching $99.92/barrel. USO...

    WTI crude drops into double-digits for the first time in 3 months, touching $99.92/barrel. USO -2.4% premarket. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • BKH

    Black Hills (NYSE:BKH) -3.4% premarket after lowering its profit forecast for 2012, citing...

    Black Hills (NYSE:BKH) -3.4% premarket after lowering its profit forecast for 2012, citing expectations for “sustained low” prices for natural gas. BKH now expects earnings from continuing operations at $1.90-$2.10/share for the year, down from its earlier $2-$2.20 forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • BYI

    Bally Technologies (NYSE:BYI) announces a new $150M share repurchase program that will replace a...

    Bally Technologies (NYSE:BYI) announces a new $150M share repurchase program that will replace a prior $550 buyback plan that was nearly used up. Shares +0.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • NES

    Heckmann (HEK) +8.1% premarket after the wastewater management company raises its full-year...

    Heckmann (HEK) +8.1% premarket after the wastewater management company raises its full-year revenue forecast to $400M-$420M vs. $370M consensus, helped by its acquisition of Thermo Fluids. For its Q1, HEK posted net loss of $3.9M, or $0.03/share, on revenue of $55M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • MAXR

    Premarket gainers: DGI +26%. DLB +21%. LNKD +10%. HEK +8%. GEOY +4%. BBVA +4%. STD +3%. MU +3%....

    Premarket gainers: DGI +26%. DLB +21%. LNKD +10%. HEK +8%. GEOY +4%. BBVA +4%. STD +3%. MU +3%. ARNA +3%.
    Losers: OTCQB:BODY -35%. SGYP -21%. EGT -6%. NRF -6%. ARCO -5%. TRIP -3%. KOG -3%. RIO -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • ALXA

    Alexza (NASDAQ:ALXA) -34.4% premarket after it says its new drug application for Adasuve, a...

    Alexza (NASDAQ:ALXA) -34.4% premarket after it says its new drug application for Adasuve, a schizophrenic and bipolar disorder treatment, can't be approved by the FDA until a deficiency at a manufacturing facility for the application is resolved.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 2 Comments
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SGYP) -22.7% premarket after announcing plans to offer 10M...

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SGYP) -22.7% premarket after announcing plans to offer 10M shares of common stock at $4.50/share to fund its research and development activities, including clinical trials of its plecanatide and SP-333 treatments for gastrointestinal disorders.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • NVAX

    Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX): Q1 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $4.64M (+475% Y/Y) beats by...

    Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX): Q1 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $4.64M (+475% Y/Y) beats by $0.2M. Shares +6.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • GEOY

    Satellite imagery company GeoEye (NASDAQ:GEOY) offers to buy rival DigitalGlobe (DGI) for $792M...

    Satellite imagery company GeoEye (NASDAQ:GEOY) offers to buy rival DigitalGlobe (DGI) for $792M in a cash-and-stock deal that would create the world's largest fleet of commercial imagery satellites. The total consideration of $17/share is a 26% premium to DGI's Thursday closing price. GEOY +4.2%, DGI +27.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM
  • ARCO

    Arcos Dorados Holding (NYSE:ARCO): Q1 EPS of $0.12 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $922M (+11.5%...

    Arcos Dorados Holding (NYSE:ARCO): Q1 EPS of $0.12 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $922M (+11.5% Y/Y) beats by $19M. Shares -3.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
  • EL

    Estee Lauder (NYSE:EL): FQ3 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $2.25B (+3.7% Y/Y) in-line....

    Estee Lauder (NYSE:EL): FQ3 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $2.25B (+3.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -4.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM

  • Crude oil continues its big late-week slide, -1.6% to $100.90/barrel. The price stood at $106.30...

    Crude oil continues its big late-week slide, -1.6% to $100.90/barrel. The price stood at $106.30 less than 72 hours ago. The steep decline coincides with a strong move higher in the greenback. Coincidence?

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM
  • BAGL

    Einstein Noah Restaurant (NASDAQ:BAGL) says it will explore strategic alternatives including a...

    Einstein Noah Restaurant (NASDAQ:BAGL) says it will explore strategic alternatives including a possible sale or business combination. Piper Jaffray has been hired to lead the process. Shares +28.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:00 AM
  • RBS

    RBS (NYSE:RBS): Q1 pretax loss of £1.4B, widening from a £116M loss in Q1 2011. Much...

    RBS (NYSE:RBS): Q1 pretax loss of 1.4B, widening from a 116M loss in Q1 2011. Much of the loss came from changes in the valuation of RBS' debt. Operating profit of 1.2B vs. 800M consensus. Sets aside an extra 125M for PPI claims. Will repay next week the last of its state emergency loans and resume dividend payments on preferential shares. Shares +2.9% in London.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 AM | 5 Comments
